episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky historical and scientific facts. The hosts discuss a bizarre punishment involving figs and mules in medieval Milan, the dangers of microwaving library books due to RFID chips, the peculiar nicknames of historical rulers, and a Chinese poem where every word is pronounced 'shi'.

facts.fact: My fact this week is that the Holy Roman Emperor once made every citizen of Milan pluck a fig from a mule's genitals with their teeth.
Okay, my fact this week is that library books can set on fire if you put them in the microwave.
My fact is that one of the kings of Leon was called Alfonso the slobberer.
My fact this week is that there is a Chinese poem made up of 92 characters in which every word is pronounced 'shi'.
